59#define IPV4_LOOPBACK_ROUTE
60#if defined(__linux__) || defined(__sun) || (defined(BSD) && defined(RTF_LOCAL))
61/* Linux has had loopback routes in the local table since 2.2
62 * Solaris does not seem to support loopback routes. */
63#undef IPV4_LOOPBACK_ROUTE
64#endif
65
66uint8_t
67inet_ntocidr(struct in_addr address)
68{
69 uint8_t cidr = 0;
70 uint32_t mask = htonl(address.s_addr);
71
72 while (mask) {
73 cidr++;
74 mask <<= 1;
75 }
76 return cidr;
77}
78
79int
80inet_cidrtoaddr(int cidr, struct in_addr *addr)
81{
82 int ocets;
83
84 if (cidr < 1 || cidr > 32) {
85 errno = EINVAL;
86 return -1;
87 }
88 ocets = (cidr + 7) / NBBY;
89
90 addr->s_addr = 0;
91 if (ocets > 0) {
92 memset(&addr->s_addr, 255, (size_t)ocets - 1);
93 memset((unsigned char *)&addr->s_addr + (ocets - 1),
94 (256 - (1 << (32 - cidr) % NBBY)), 1);
95 }
96
97 return 0;
98}
99
100uint32_t
101ipv4_getnetmask(uint32_t addr)
102{
103 uint32_t dst;
104
105 if (addr == 0)
106 return 0;
107
108 dst = htonl(addr);
109 if (IN_CLASSA(dst))
110 return ntohl(IN_CLASSA_NET);
111 if (IN_CLASSB(dst))
112 return ntohl(IN_CLASSB_NET);
113 if (IN_CLASSC(dst))
114 return ntohl(IN_CLASSC_NET);
115
116 return 0;
117}
118
119struct ipv4_addr *
120ipv4_iffindaddr(struct interface *ifp,
121 const struct in_addr *addr, const struct in_addr *mask)
122{
123 struct ipv4_state *state;
124 struct ipv4_addr *ap;
125
126 state = IPV4_STATE(ifp);
127 if (state) {
128 TAILQ_FOREACH(ap, &state->addrs, next) {
129 if ((addr == NULL || ap->addr.s_addr == addr->s_addr) &&
130 (mask == NULL || ap->mask.s_addr == mask->s_addr))
131 return ap;
132 }
133 }
134 return NULL;
135}
136
137struct ipv4_addr *
138ipv4_iffindlladdr(struct interface *ifp)
139{
140 struct ipv4_state *state;
141 struct ipv4_addr *ap;
142
143 state = IPV4_STATE(ifp);
144 if (state) {
145 TAILQ_FOREACH(ap, &state->addrs, next) {
146 if (IN_LINKLOCAL(htonl(ap->addr.s_addr)))
147 return ap;
148 }
149 }
150 return NULL;
151}
152
153static struct ipv4_addr *
154ipv4_iffindmaskaddr(struct interface *ifp, const struct in_addr *addr)
155{
156 struct ipv4_state *state;
157 struct ipv4_addr *ap;
158
159 state = IPV4_STATE(ifp);
160 if (state) {
161 TAILQ_FOREACH (ap, &state->addrs, next) {
162 if ((ap->addr.s_addr & ap->mask.s_addr) ==
163 (addr->s_addr & ap->mask.s_addr))
164 return ap;
165 }
166 }
167 return NULL;
168}
169
170struct ipv4_addr *
171ipv4_findaddr(struct dhcpcd_ctx *ctx, const struct in_addr *addr)
172{
173 struct interface *ifp;
174 struct ipv4_addr *ap;
175
176 TAILQ_FOREACH(ifp, ctx->ifaces, next) {
177 ap = ipv4_iffindaddr(ifp, addr, NULL);
178 if (ap)
179 return ap;
180 }
181 return NULL;
182}
183
184struct ipv4_addr *
185ipv4_findmaskaddr(struct dhcpcd_ctx *ctx, const struct in_addr *addr)
186{
187 struct interface *ifp;
188 struct ipv4_addr *ap;
189
190 TAILQ_FOREACH(ifp, ctx->ifaces, next) {
191 ap = ipv4_iffindmaskaddr(ifp, addr);
192 if (ap)
193 return ap;
194 }
195 return NULL;
196}
197
198int
199ipv4_hasaddr(const struct interface *ifp)
200{
201 const struct dhcp_state *dstate;
202
203#ifdef IPV4LL
204 if (IPV4LL_STATE_RUNNING(ifp))
205 return 1;
206#endif
207
208 dstate = D_CSTATE(ifp);
209 return (dstate &&
210 dstate->added == STATE_ADDED &&
211 dstate->addr != NULL);
212}
213
214/* Interface comparer for working out ordering. */
215int
216ipv4_ifcmp(const struct interface *si, const struct interface *ti)
217{
218 const struct dhcp_state *sis, *tis;
219
220 sis = D_CSTATE(si);
221 tis = D_CSTATE(ti);
222 if (sis && !tis)
223 return -1;
224 if (!sis && tis)
225 return 1;
226 if (!sis && !tis)
227 return 0;
228 /* If one has a lease and the other not, it takes precedence. */
229 if (sis->new && !tis->new)
230 return -1;
231 if (!sis->new && tis->new)
232 return 1;
233 /* Always prefer proper leases */
234 if (!(sis->added & STATE_FAKE) && (tis->added & STATE_FAKE))
235 return -1;
236 if ((sis->added & STATE_FAKE) && !(tis->added & STATE_FAKE))
237 return 1;
238 /* If we are either, they neither have a lease, or they both have.
239 * We need to check for IPv4LL and make it non-preferred. */
240 if (sis->new && tis->new) {
241 if (IS_DHCP(sis->new) && !IS_DHCP(tis->new))
242 return -1;
243 if (!IS_DHCP(sis->new) && IS_DHCP(tis->new))
244 return 1;
245 }
246 return 0;
247}
248
249static int
250inet_dhcproutes(struct rt_head *routes, struct interface *ifp)
251{
252 const struct dhcp_state *state;
253 struct rt_head nroutes;
254 struct rt *rt, *r = NULL;
255 struct in_addr in;
256 uint16_t mtu;
257 int n;
258
259 state = D_CSTATE(ifp);
260 if (state == NULL || state->state != DHS_BOUND || !state->added)
261 return 0;
262
263 /* An address does have to exist. */
264 assert(state->addr);
265
266 TAILQ_INIT(&nroutes);
267
268 /* First, add a subnet route. */
269 if (!(ifp->flags & IFF_POINTOPOINT) &&
270#ifndef BSD
271 /* BSD adds a route in this instance */
272 state->addr->mask.s_addr != INADDR_BROADCAST &&
273#endif
274 state->addr->mask.s_addr != INADDR_ANY)
275 {
276 if ((rt = rt_new(ifp)) == NULL)
277 return -1;
278 rt->rt_dflags |= RTDF_IFA_ROUTE;
279 in.s_addr = state->addr->addr.s_addr & state->addr->mask.s_addr;
280 sa_in_init(&rt->rt_dest, &in);
281 in.s_addr = state->addr->mask.s_addr;
282 sa_in_init(&rt->rt_netmask, &in);
283 //in.s_addr = INADDR_ANY;
284 //sa_in_init(&rt->rt_gateway, &in);
285 rt->rt_gateway.sa_family = AF_UNSPEC;
286 TAILQ_INSERT_HEAD(&nroutes, rt, rt_next);
287 }
288
289 /* If any set routes, grab them, otherwise DHCP routes. */
290 if (TAILQ_FIRST(&ifp->options->routes)) {
291 TAILQ_FOREACH(r, &ifp->options->routes, rt_next) {
292 if (sa_is_unspecified(&r->rt_gateway))
293 break;
294 if ((rt = rt_new0(ifp->ctx)) == NULL)
295 return -1;
296 memcpy(rt, r, sizeof(*rt));
297 rt_setif(rt, ifp);
298 rt->rt_dflags = RTDF_STATIC;
299 TAILQ_INSERT_TAIL(&nroutes, rt, rt_next);
300 }
301 } else {
302 if (dhcp_get_routes(&nroutes, ifp) == -1)
303 return -1;
304 }
305
306 /* If configured, Install a gateway to the desintion
307 * for P2P interfaces. */
308 if (ifp->flags & IFF_POINTOPOINT &&
309 has_option_mask(ifp->options->dstmask, DHO_ROUTER))
310 {
311 if ((rt = rt_new(ifp)) == NULL)
312 return -1;
313 in.s_addr = INADDR_ANY;
314 sa_in_init(&rt->rt_dest, &in);
315 sa_in_init(&rt->rt_netmask, &in);
316 sa_in_init(&rt->rt_gateway, &state->addr->brd);
317 sa_in_init(&rt->rt_ifa, &state->addr->addr);
318 TAILQ_INSERT_HEAD(routes, rt, rt_next);
319 }
320
321 /* Copy our address as the source address and set mtu */
322 mtu = dhcp_get_mtu(ifp);
323 n = 0;
324 TAILQ_FOREACH(rt, &nroutes, rt_next) {
325 rt->rt_mtu = mtu;
326 if (!(rt->rt_dflags & RTDF_STATIC))
327 rt->rt_dflags |= RTDF_DHCP;
328 sa_in_init(&rt->rt_ifa, &state->addr->addr);
329 n++;
330 }
331 TAILQ_CONCAT(routes, &nroutes, rt_next);
332
333 return n;
334}
335
336/* We should check to ensure the routers are on the same subnet
337 * OR supply a host route. If not, warn and add a host route. */
338static int
339inet_routerhostroute(struct rt_head *routes, struct interface *ifp)
340{
341 struct rt *rt, *rth;
342 struct sockaddr_in *dest, *netmask, *gateway;
343 const char *cp, *cp2, *cp3, *cplim;
344 struct if_options *ifo;
345 const struct dhcp_state *state;
346 struct in_addr in;
347
348 /* Don't add a host route for these interfaces. */
349 if (ifp->flags & (IFF_LOOPBACK | IFF_POINTOPOINT))
350 return 0;
351
352 TAILQ_FOREACH(rt, routes, rt_next) {
353 if (rt->rt_dest.sa_family != AF_INET)
354 continue;
355 if (!sa_is_unspecified(&rt->rt_dest) ||
356 sa_is_unspecified(&rt->rt_gateway))
357 continue;
358 gateway = satosin(&rt->rt_gateway);
359 /* Scan for a route to match */
360 TAILQ_FOREACH(rth, routes, rt_next) {
361 if (rth == rt)
362 break;
363 /* match host */
364 if (sa_cmp(&rth->rt_dest, &rt->rt_gateway) == 0)
365 break;
366 /* match subnet */
367 cp = (const char *)&gateway->sin_addr.s_addr;
368 dest = satosin(&rth->rt_dest);
369 cp2 = (const char *)&dest->sin_addr.s_addr;
370 netmask = satosin(&rth->rt_netmask);
371 cp3 = (const char *)&netmask->sin_addr.s_addr;
372 cplim = cp3 + sizeof(netmask->sin_addr.s_addr);
373 while (cp3 < cplim) {
374 if ((*cp++ ^ *cp2++) & *cp3++)
375 break;
376 }
377 if (cp3 == cplim)
378 break;
379 }
380 if (rth != rt)
381 continue;
382 if ((state = D_CSTATE(ifp)) == NULL)
383 continue;
384 ifo = ifp->options;
385 if (ifp->flags & IFF_NOARP) {
386 if (!(ifo->options & DHCPCD_ROUTER_HOST_ROUTE_WARNED) &&
387 !(state->added & STATE_FAKE))
388 {
389 char buf[INET_MAX_ADDRSTRLEN];
390
391 ifo->options |= DHCPCD_ROUTER_HOST_ROUTE_WARNED;
392 logwarnx("%s: forcing router %s through "
393 "interface",
394 ifp->name,
395 sa_addrtop(&rt->rt_gateway,
396 buf, sizeof(buf)));
397 }
398 gateway->sin_addr.s_addr = INADDR_ANY;
399 continue;
400 }
401 if (!(ifo->options & DHCPCD_ROUTER_HOST_ROUTE_WARNED) &&
402 !(state->added & STATE_FAKE))
403 {
404 char buf[INET_MAX_ADDRSTRLEN];
405
406 ifo->options |= DHCPCD_ROUTER_HOST_ROUTE_WARNED;
407 logwarnx("%s: router %s requires a host route",
408 ifp->name,
409 sa_addrtop(&rt->rt_gateway, buf, sizeof(buf)));
410 }
411 if ((rth = rt_new(ifp)) == NULL)
412 return -1;
413 rth->rt_flags |= RTF_HOST;
414 sa_in_init(&rth->rt_dest, &gateway->sin_addr);
415 in.s_addr = INADDR_BROADCAST;
416 sa_in_init(&rth->rt_netmask, &in);
417 in.s_addr = INADDR_ANY;
418 sa_in_init(&rth->rt_gateway, &in);
419 rth->rt_mtu = dhcp_get_mtu(ifp);
420 sa_in_init(&rth->rt_ifa, &state->addr->addr);
421 TAILQ_INSERT_BEFORE(rt, rth, rt_next);
422 }
423 return 0;
424}
425
426bool
427inet_getroutes(struct dhcpcd_ctx *ctx, struct rt_head *routes)
428{
429 struct interface *ifp;
430#ifdef IPV4LL
431 struct rt def;
432 bool have_default;
433#endif
434
435 TAILQ_FOREACH(ifp, ctx->ifaces, next) {
436 if (!ifp->active)
437 continue;
438 if (inet_dhcproutes(routes, ifp) == -1)
439 return false;
440#ifdef IPV4LL
441 if (ipv4ll_subnetroute(routes, ifp) == -1)
442 return false;
443#endif
444 if (inet_routerhostroute(routes, ifp) == -1)
445 return false;
446 }
447
448#ifdef IPV4LL
449 /* If there is no default route, see if we can use an IPv4LL one. */
450 memset(&def, 0, sizeof(def));
451 def.rt_dest.sa_family = AF_INET;
452 have_default = (rt_find(routes, &def) != NULL);
453 if (!have_default) {
454 TAILQ_FOREACH(ifp, ctx->ifaces, next) {
455 if (ifp->active &&
456 ipv4ll_defaultroute(routes, ifp) == 1)
457 break;
458 }
459 }
460#endif
461
462 return true;
463}
464
465int
466ipv4_deladdr(struct ipv4_addr *addr, int keeparp)
467{
468 int r;
469 struct ipv4_state *state;
470 struct ipv4_addr *ap;
471#ifdef ARP
472 struct arp_state *astate;
473#else
474 UNUSED(keeparp);
475#endif
476
477 logdebugx("%s: deleting IP address %s",
478 addr->iface->name, addr->saddr);
479
480 r = if_address(RTM_DELADDR, addr);
481 if (r == -1 &&
482 errno != EADDRNOTAVAIL && errno != ESRCH &&
483 errno != ENXIO && errno != ENODEV)
484 logerr("%s: %s", addr->iface->name, __func__);
485
486#ifdef ARP
487 if (!keeparp && (astate = arp_find(addr->iface, &addr->addr)) != NULL)
488 arp_free(astate);
489#endif
490
491 state = IPV4_STATE(addr->iface);
492 TAILQ_FOREACH(ap, &state->addrs, next) {
493 if (IPV4_MASK_EQ(ap, addr)) {
494 struct dhcp_state *dstate;
495
496 dstate = D_STATE(ap->iface);
497 TAILQ_REMOVE(&state->addrs, ap, next);
498 free(ap);
499
500 if (dstate && dstate->addr == ap) {
501 dstate->added = 0;
502 dstate->addr = NULL;
503 }
504 break;
505 }
506 }
507
508 return r;
509}
510
511static int
512delete_address(struct interface *ifp)
513{
514 int r;
515 struct if_options *ifo;
516 struct dhcp_state *state;
517
518 state = D_STATE(ifp);
519 ifo = ifp->options;
520 /* The lease could have been added, but the address deleted
521 * by a 3rd party. */
522 if (state->addr == NULL ||
523 ifo->options & DHCPCD_INFORM ||
524 (ifo->options & DHCPCD_STATIC && ifo->req_addr.s_addr == 0))
525 return 0;
526 r = ipv4_deladdr(state->addr, 0);
527 return r;
528}
529
530struct ipv4_state *
531ipv4_getstate(struct interface *ifp)
532{
533 struct ipv4_state *state;
534
535 state = IPV4_STATE(ifp);
536 if (state == NULL) {
537 ifp->if_data[IF_DATA_IPV4] = malloc(sizeof(*state));
538 state = IPV4_STATE(ifp);
539 if (state == NULL) {
540 logerr(__func__);
541 return NULL;
542 }
543 TAILQ_INIT(&state->addrs);
544 state->buffer_size = state->buffer_len = state->buffer_pos = 0;
545 state->buffer = NULL;
546 }
547 return state;
548}
549
550#ifdef ALIAS_ADDR
551/* Find the next logical aliase address we can use. */
552static int
553ipv4_aliasaddr(struct ipv4_addr *ia, struct ipv4_addr **repl)
554{
555 struct ipv4_state *state;
556 struct ipv4_addr *iap;
557 unsigned int lun;
558 char alias[IF_NAMESIZE];
559
560 if (ia->alias[0] != '\0')
561 return 0;
562
563 lun = 0;
564 state = IPV4_STATE(ia->iface);
565find_lun:
566 if (if_makealias(alias, IF_NAMESIZE, ia->iface->name, lun) >=
567 IF_NAMESIZE)
568 {
569 errno = ENOMEM;
570 return -1;
571 }
572 TAILQ_FOREACH(iap, &state->addrs, next) {
573 if (iap->alias[0] != '\0' && iap->addr.s_addr == INADDR_ANY) {
574 /* No address assigned? Lets use it. */
575 strlcpy(ia->alias, iap->alias, sizeof(ia->alias));
576 if (repl)
577 *repl = iap;
578 return 1;
579 }
580 if (strcmp(iap->alias, alias) == 0)
581 break;
582 }
583
584 if (iap != NULL) {
585 if (lun == UINT_MAX) {
586 errno = ERANGE;
587 return -1;
588 }
589 lun++;
590 goto find_lun;
591 }
592
593 strlcpy(ia->alias, alias, sizeof(ia->alias));
594 return 0;
595}
596#endif
597
598struct ipv4_addr *
599ipv4_addaddr(struct interface *ifp, const struct in_addr *addr,
600 const struct in_addr *mask, const struct in_addr *bcast)
601{
602 struct ipv4_state *state;
603 struct ipv4_addr *ia;
604 bool is_new = false;
605#ifdef ALIAS_ADDR
606 int replaced, blank;
607 struct ipv4_addr *replaced_ia;
608#endif
609
610 if ((state = ipv4_getstate(ifp)) == NULL) {
611 logerr(__func__);
612 return NULL;
613 }
614 if (ifp->options->options & DHCPCD_NOALIAS) {
615 struct ipv4_addr *ian;
616
617 TAILQ_FOREACH_SAFE(ia, &state->addrs, next, ian) {
618 if (ia->addr.s_addr != addr->s_addr)
619 ipv4_deladdr(ia, 0);
620 }
621 }
622
623 ia = ipv4_iffindaddr(ifp, addr, NULL);
624 if (ia == NULL) {
625 ia = malloc(sizeof(*ia));
626 if (ia == NULL) {
627 logerr(__func__);
628 return NULL;
629 }
630 ia->iface = ifp;
631 ia->addr = *addr;
632#ifdef IN_IFF_TENTATIVE
633 ia->addr_flags = IN_IFF_TENTATIVE;
634#endif
635 is_new = true;
636 }
637
638 ia->mask = *mask;
639 ia->brd = *bcast;
640 snprintf(ia->saddr, sizeof(ia->saddr), "%s/%d",
641 inet_ntoa(*addr), inet_ntocidr(*mask));
642
643#ifdef ALIAS_ADDR
644 blank = (ia->alias[0] == '\0');
645 if ((replaced = ipv4_aliasaddr(ia, &replaced_ia)) == -1) {
646 logerr("%s: ipv4_aliasaddr", ifp->name);
647 free(ia);
648 return NULL;
649 }
650 if (blank)
651 logdebugx("%s: aliased %s", ia->alias, ia->saddr);
652#endif
653
654 logdebugx("%s: adding IP address %s broadcast %s",
655 ifp->name, ia->saddr, inet_ntoa(*bcast));
656 if (if_address(RTM_NEWADDR, ia) == -1) {
657 if (errno != EEXIST)
658 logerr("%s: if_addaddress",
659 __func__);
660 free(ia);
661 return NULL;
662 }
663
664#ifdef ALIAS_ADDR
665 if (replaced) {
666 TAILQ_REMOVE(&state->addrs, replaced_ia, next);
667 free(replaced_ia);
668 }
669#endif
670
671 if (is_new)
672 TAILQ_INSERT_TAIL(&state->addrs, ia, next);
673 return ia;
674}
675
676static int
677ipv4_daddaddr(struct interface *ifp, const struct dhcp_lease *lease)
678{
679 struct dhcp_state *state;
680 struct ipv4_addr *ia;
681
682 ia = ipv4_addaddr(ifp, &lease->addr, &lease->mask, &lease->brd);
683 if (ia == NULL)
684 return -1;
685
686 state = D_STATE(ifp);
687 state->added = STATE_ADDED;
688 state->addr = ia;
689 return 0;
690}
691
692void
693ipv4_applyaddr(void *arg)
694{
695 struct interface *ifp = arg;
696 struct dhcp_state *state = D_STATE(ifp);
697 struct dhcp_lease *lease;
698 struct if_options *ifo = ifp->options;
699 struct ipv4_addr *ia;
700 int r;
701
702 if (state == NULL)
703 return;
704
705 lease = &state->lease;
706 if (state->new == NULL) {
707 if ((ifo->options & (DHCPCD_EXITING | DHCPCD_PERSISTENT)) !=
708 (DHCPCD_EXITING | DHCPCD_PERSISTENT))
709 {
710 if (state->added) {
711 delete_address(ifp);
712 rt_build(ifp->ctx, AF_INET);
713#ifdef ARP
714 /* Announce the preferred address to
715 * kick ARP caches. */
716 arp_announceaddr(ifp->ctx, &lease->addr);
717#endif
718 }
719 script_runreason(ifp, state->reason);
720 } else
721 rt_build(ifp->ctx, AF_INET);
722 return;
723 }
724
725 /* If the netmask or broadcast is different, re-add the addresss */
726 ia = ipv4_iffindaddr(ifp, &lease->addr, NULL);
727 if (ia &&
728 ia->mask.s_addr == lease->mask.s_addr &&
729 ia->brd.s_addr == lease->brd.s_addr)
730 logdebugx("%s: IP address %s already exists",
731 ifp->name, ia->saddr);
732 else {
733#if __linux__
734 /* Linux does not change netmask/broadcast address
735 * for re-added addresses, so we need to delete the old one
736 * first. */
737 if (ia != NULL)
738 ipv4_deladdr(ia, 0);
739#endif
740 r = ipv4_daddaddr(ifp, lease);
741 if (r == -1 && errno != EEXIST)
742 return;
743 }
744
745 ia = ipv4_iffindaddr(ifp, &lease->addr, NULL);
746 if (ia == NULL) {
747 logerrx("%s: added address vanished", ifp->name);
748 return;
749 }
750#if defined(ARP) && defined(IN_IFF_NOTUSEABLE)
751 if (ia->addr_flags & IN_IFF_NOTUSEABLE)
752 return;
753#endif
754
755 /* Delete the old address if different */
756 if (state->addr &&
757 state->addr->addr.s_addr != lease->addr.s_addr &&
758 ipv4_iffindaddr(ifp, &lease->addr, NULL))
759 delete_address(ifp);
760
761 state->addr = ia;
762 state->added = STATE_ADDED;
763
764 /* Find any freshly added routes, such as the subnet route.
765 * We do this because we cannot rely on recieving the kernel
766 * notification right now via our link socket. */
767 if_initrt(ifp->ctx, AF_INET);
768 rt_build(ifp->ctx, AF_INET);
769
770#ifdef ARP
771 arp_announceaddr(ifp->ctx, &state->addr->addr);
772#endif
773
774 if (state->state == DHS_BOUND) {
775 script_runreason(ifp, state->reason);
776 dhcpcd_daemonise(ifp->ctx);
777 }
778}
779
780void
781ipv4_markaddrsstale(struct interface *ifp)
782{
783 struct ipv4_state *state;
784 struct ipv4_addr *ia;
785
786 state = IPV4_STATE(ifp);
787 if (state == NULL)
788 return;
789
790 TAILQ_FOREACH(ia, &state->addrs, next) {
791 ia->flags |= IPV4_AF_STALE;
792 }
793}
794
795void
796ipv4_deletestaleaddrs(struct interface *ifp)
797{
798 struct ipv4_state *state;
799 struct ipv4_addr *ia, *ia1;
800
801 state = IPV4_STATE(ifp);
802 if (state == NULL)
803 return;
804
805 TAILQ_FOREACH_SAFE(ia, &state->addrs, next, ia1) {
806 if (!(ia->flags & IPV4_AF_STALE))
807 continue;
808 ipv4_handleifa(ifp->ctx, RTM_DELADDR,
809 ifp->ctx->ifaces, ifp->name,
810 &ia->addr, &ia->mask, &ia->brd, 0, getpid());
811 }
812}
813
814void
815ipv4_handleifa(struct dhcpcd_ctx *ctx,
816 int cmd, struct if_head *ifs, const char *ifname,
817 const struct in_addr *addr, const struct in_addr *mask,
818 const struct in_addr *brd, int addrflags, pid_t pid)
819{
820 struct interface *ifp;
821 struct ipv4_state *state;
822 struct ipv4_addr *ia;
823 bool ia_is_new;
824
825#if 0
826 char sbrdbuf[INET_ADDRSTRLEN];
827 const char *sbrd;
828
829 if (brd)
830 sbrd = inet_ntop(AF_INET, brd, sbrdbuf, sizeof(sbrdbuf));
831 else
832 sbrd = NULL;
833 logdebugx("%s: %s %s/%d %s %d", ifname,
834 cmd == RTM_NEWADDR ? "RTM_NEWADDR" :
835 cmd == RTM_DELADDR ? "RTM_DELADDR" : "???",
836 inet_ntoa(*addr), inet_ntocidr(*mask), sbrd, addrflags);
837#endif
838
839 if (ifs == NULL)
840 ifs = ctx->ifaces;
841 if (ifs == NULL) {
842 errno = ESRCH;
843 return;
844 }
845 if ((ifp = if_find(ifs, ifname)) == NULL)
846 return;
847 if ((state = ipv4_getstate(ifp)) == NULL) {
848 errno = ENOENT;
849 return;
850 }
851
852 ia = ipv4_iffindaddr(ifp, addr, NULL);
853 switch (cmd) {
854 case RTM_NEWADDR:
855 if (ia == NULL) {
856 if ((ia = malloc(sizeof(*ia))) == NULL) {
857 logerr(__func__);
858 return;
859 }
860 ia->iface = ifp;
861 ia->addr = *addr;
862 ia->mask = *mask;
863 ia->flags = 0;
864 ia_is_new = true;
865#ifdef ALIAS_ADDR
866 strlcpy(ia->alias, ifname, sizeof(ia->alias));
867#endif
868 TAILQ_INSERT_TAIL(&state->addrs, ia, next);
869 } else
870 ia_is_new = false;
871 /* Mask could have changed */
872 if (ia_is_new ||
873 (mask->s_addr != INADDR_ANY &&
874 mask->s_addr != ia->mask.s_addr))
875 {
876 ia->mask = *mask;
877 snprintf(ia->saddr, sizeof(ia->saddr), "%s/%d",
878 inet_ntoa(*addr), inet_ntocidr(*mask));
879 }
880 if (brd != NULL)
881 ia->brd = *brd;
882 else
883 ia->brd.s_addr = INADDR_ANY;
884 ia->addr_flags = addrflags;
885 ia->flags &= ~IPV4_AF_STALE;
886 break;
887 case RTM_DELADDR:
888 if (ia == NULL)
889 return;
890 if (mask->s_addr != INADDR_ANY &&
891 mask->s_addr != ia->mask.s_addr)
892 return;
893 TAILQ_REMOVE(&state->addrs, ia, next);
894 break;
895 default:
896 return;
897 }
898
899 if (addr->s_addr != INADDR_ANY && addr->s_addr != INADDR_BROADCAST) {
900#ifdef ARP
901 arp_handleifa(cmd, ia);
902#endif
903 dhcp_handleifa(cmd, ia, pid);
904 }
905
906 if (cmd == RTM_DELADDR)
907 free(ia);
908}
909
910void
911ipv4_free(struct interface *ifp)
912{
913 struct ipv4_state *state;
914 struct ipv4_addr *ia;
915
916 if (ifp) {
917 state = IPV4_STATE(ifp);
918 if (state) {
919 while ((ia = TAILQ_FIRST(&state->addrs))) {
920 TAILQ_REMOVE(&state->addrs, ia, next);
921 free(ia);
922 }
923 free(state->buffer);
924 free(state);
925 }
926 }
927}
